meanings.sent1: After the storm, he resecured the windows to prevent any leaks.
meanings.sent2: She resecured her bike lock to make sure it wouldn't get stolen.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel resecured its stash of acorns in a more hidden spot.
meanings.sent4: The knight resecured his sword in its sheath before facing the dragon.
meanings.sent5: The detective resecured the crime scene to preserve any crucial evidence.

meanings.definition: To make safe or secure again
meanings.sent1: The lifeguard quickly resecured the pool area after the children left.
meanings.sent2: The homeowner resecured the fence to keep the dog from escaping.
meanings.sent3: The chef resecured the lid on the pot to prevent any spills.
meanings.sent4: The astronaut resecured his helmet before the spacewalk.
meanings.sent5: The librarian resecured the rare book in its protective case.
